Dialogue: I'm calling a cab. Maybe I'll only be somewhat late for work. Colter watches her, a quiet ache inside. Maybe some people don't want to be saved.

Speaker: goodwin
Dialogue: Thank you for your service. Time to go home. Goodwin's hand goes to the switch to shut off life support. His eyes on the clock. It reads 30 SECONDS.

Speaker: colter
Dialogue: Hey. She turns. Colter gets up.

Speaker: colter
Dialogue: You can do anything you want with your life. Starting right now. She's taken aback. He starts walking off.

Speaker: christina
Dialogue: Wait. Colter turns. She crosses her arms archly.

Speaker: christina
Dialogue: You can't just expect someone to change her life just like that. At the very least... you'd have to buy that person coffee and explain your reasons. She waits for his response. Uneasy at putting herself out there. Colter's watch ticks down to the final seconds. His last moments in this world. He has only time enough for a final look of reassurance.

Speaker: colter
Dialogue: Maybe some other time. Disappointment flickers on her face. She turns to go. Behind her is a STONE WALL. A BICYCLE is parked against it. Colter's breath catches in his throat. This is it! This is the mysterious scene he's been seeing! HIS WATCH - Hits ZERO.

Speaker: rutledge
Dialogue: Arrest him! Goodwin backs away from the gurney, hands in the air. The BEEPING has given way to a MONOTONE. All of Colter's vital signs have FLATLINED.

Speaker: rutledge
Dialogue: He's dying...! Rutledge frantically goes to reconnect the machines -- but Goodwin has turned off too many of them.

Speaker: rutledge
Dialogue: Get a medical team in here! Move! But the MPs just stare at the appalling sight of Colter's exposed brain.

Speaker: rutledge
Dialogue: I guess force is the only thing you people understa --

Speaker: mp
Dialogue: Back away, sir, now! The MP has leveled his rifle at Rutledge. Who steps back, aghast. His authority has vanished with Colter's life. Goodwin shuts off the monitors. Silence fills the room. Colter is dead. Rutledge stares sorrowfully at Colter's body. Then at Goodwin with burning hatred.

Speaker: rutledge
Dialogue: You're a murderer. Goodwin offers his hands to the MP.

Speaker: goodwin
Dialogue: Go ahead and arrest me. But the MP does nothing.

Speaker: goodwin
Dialogue: I'll be around. Whenever you want me. They part as he walks out of the room. A look of grim satisfaction on his face.

Speaker: christina
Dialogue: You okay? Colter turns to her. How can this be? He's afraid to even speak. As if that alone could break the enchantment. But the world is here. It goes on. That's all he knows. Finally he swallows. Finding his voice.

Speaker: colter
Dialogue: You're right. The least I can do is buy you coffee. This pleases Christina, although she tries not to show it.

Speaker: christina
Dialogue: Okay, well, come on then. Walking forward, he joins her. The two of them disappear down the tunnel. A beautiful morning.
